name: Jet Park Auckland Airport Hotel & Conference Centre

reviews.text: I've stayed at Jet Park a number of times and have always found it to be convenient and a great place to rest in between flights. Their pick up for the airport service is great and operates all hours of the night. I would recommend this hotel to all.
reviews.title: Great close to the airport accommodation

reviews.text: The hotel provided free shuttle bus from the airport, which was convenient when we were arriving very late. Deluxe Twin Rooms suitable for 2 adults 2 young kids. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Very nice hotel to stay at when flying out the next morning.
reviews.title: Great stopover hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed here many times in the past and it was very much an airport hotel. We stayed here late August and I was so impressed with everything. Top of my list was the service. Nothing was a problem to any of the staff.. from information many room service requests. Everything was treated with a smile. We stayed in a renovated room and it was really lovely. The rooms had a selection of pillows, lovely big beds with soft throws. The bathroom had all sorts of lovely treats. I hadn't expected much at all, but was a great start to our holiday. We also received 2 whole weeks complimentary parking with our one nights accommodation! If you book on their website they have some guarantee to beat any internet offer.. i think!
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant and really enjoyed our meal. The menu was extensive and the service was again great.
reviews.title: Value for money A+ service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm trying to fault this as it isn't a 5 star hotel, but it did exceed all my expectations. It does have long narrow hallways which can make the journey to the room a long one - there I found one!
reviews.title: Airport motel.
Perfect for first night in NZ
reviews.text: nice, big and clean rooms, helpful staff, free airport shuttle and good breakfast make this a great choice for arriving or departing in Auckland. Easy bus to downtown and car rental company picked us up from hotel on second day. We were able to check in early morning without problems, which is very helpful.

We spent our last night in New Zealand at the Jet Park Airport Hotel. We wanted something close to the airport as we were flying out early the next morning. The room was typical for an airport hotel, although it looked like the hotel had been recently remodeled. We had dinner in the bar and the food was good and the staff was very friendly. The staff at the front desk were not very pleasant or helpful and we were surprised that they would charge for internet access either in your room or the business center with the number of people on business we saw at the hotel.
reviews.title: Affordable and close to airport

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because of it's location to the airport as we had a 6:30am international flight the next morning. For location this hotel was perfect.
reviews.title: Cleanliness = 0

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we were a little earlier than check in time the staff still checked us in which was great. The staff were friendly. I saw the 4 star NZ sticker on the front doors so thought we were in for a comfortable night.
reviews.title: most comfortable bed have ever had in hotel room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first encounter was when I had a trolley full of bags going down the hallway and met the cleaners with their trolleys. She was MOST unimpressed when she had to move it so I could pass.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you need to stay by the airport

reviews.text: Have stayed in this Hotel many times before and have had good stays. However this time I was not overly impressed.
reviews.title: Not up to their usual standards

reviews.text: I had rung up the week before and speciafically requested a room that overlooked the Motorway. (why? because it has a view and is actually quieter).
reviews.title: Inconsistency in service and rooms quality… Not happy with staff attitude.

reviews.text: When I went to check in at 2.30pm I was told my room wasnt ready..so had to come back at 5pm.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfy, Excellent Shuttle Service

reviews.text: When I got to my room it was not what I requested as it was above the kitchen and four huge and nosiy air con units ....as well as that there was a kitchen chimmey right outside my window and the smell wasnt plesant. (even though there was double glazing).
reviews.title: Room is ok, Restaurant terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went back to reception and asked for another room and outlined my earlier request. All though the receptionsist was polite, she didnt really want to help me and said they were booked up. She advised that all the rooms have those air con units and that I was facing the motorway. I advised no, as I was facing a red wall and not all the rooms were above the kitchen. In the end I gave up.
reviews.title: Very welcoming, stop over to LA, let us in the room on arrival

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night between flights. OUr room was beautiful, clean and newly furnished. The bathroom was spacious, clean and modern. The room all in all was very modern and comfortable. We had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. Loved the little pillow. The price was just right. We had a free shuttle to and from the airport. We ate in the dining room for dinner. Service was ok. The food and wine was quite pricey but if not exceptional very adequate.. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Excellent for overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on two separate nights on our way into and out of New Zealand. Were very impressed by the level of service and rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard rooms, from what we could see from the hallway, were pretty basic but the delux rooms are very comfortable, quiet and have every facility you could want for an overnight stay. The bathrooms are large and clean with big showers and good ammenities such as toothbrushes and shavers.
reviews.title: best stopover..

reviews.text: The restaurant food is nothing special but quite satisfactory. The service, however, is better than you would normally encounter in a busy airport hotel. On our second stay in particular there was a large number of people who arrived at the same time as we did (in fact, when we rang they told us that we would have to wait some time for the shuttle bus as they were so busy. We decided to catch a taxi which was a rather hefty $30 for just a short ride - the only negative of our stay). Despite the number of people, however, the reception was efficient and the porter very friendly and helpful. The same was true of the restaurant staff who were obviously rushed but still efficient and friendly. We had a good, quiet nights sleep on both occassions (very comfy beds and pillows) and our wake up calls and shuttles to the airport were all on time.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, friendly and handy to airport

reviews.text: Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A motel without parking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on our 1st night arriving and our last night going Home.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: It was all I expected, Good value for money,Clean ,well run and nice rooms. Very good Shuttle Bus to and from the hotel. We left at 3-00 am ( Ough ) coming home, but it was all well organized even at that time in the morning.( obviously we did not have breakfast.) Our rooms were what I expect for a 1 night stay,clean, good bed and shower. Not very big. On our last night,coming home, when we checked in,I mentioned a quiet room. Not backing onto the road behind. ( We live in a very quiet area and so not use to noise.) The manager was more than helpful and moved us down the corridor i.e. at the side. Which was excellent. All windows are double glazed so it will be adequate for most people. We had breakfast on our 1st visit,which was very good. But like all airport hotels a bit expensive.Had a couple of glasses of wine on our last night in the lounge Bar, Good chatty bar man and very knowledgeable. Wine nice but 10$ per glass. Would stay here again if I was flying in and out .But not if I wanted to go into Auckland city.
reviews.title: Always Reliable

reviews.text: I have always enjoyed staying at this hotel when on early morning flights out of Auckland International airport. Staff are very welcoming and friendly - a hotel with a smile!. Dinner in the hotel restaurant is excellent. Shuttle service to airport works a treat.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure

reviews.text: Rooms are very clean, beds very comfortable, bathrooms well equipped. I find the Queen Rooms are perfect for the short overnight stay to an early flight and I've not been troubled by exterior noise.
reviews.title: 4th Jetpark visit

reviews.text: It needs to be remembered that this hotel is in the environs of an airport/ light industrial area so not handy to inner city entertainment/things to do - it is what it is, an airport transfer hotel with a great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: The hotel cannot be faulted, the rooms were large and clean and newly decorated. the amenities were very good, The hotel restaurant offered a good selection. The bar although a little pricey was well stocked and offered an outside area to enjoy the air or have a smoke if so desired. they offered a pick up and drop off at the airport, which arrived on time. All in all a very good hotel, if it were closer to the city I would suggest staying longer.
reviews.title: excellent stopover hotel

reviews.text: Booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and have to say this hotel really does live up to it's rating in a fairly grim industrial area. Perfect for the airport - good service, hotel is clean, rooms are big and the food is pretty good given the fact that it's really targetting a transient clientelle. Big plus for the free airport transit - they even picked me up hours after we checked in when I went back to the airport to drop off our car with the rental agent.
reviews.title: Perfect for Auckland Airport

reviews.text: Only tricky issue was actually finding the place - not that obvious how to get there if you don't know the area and are not using the shuttle, so take a map/GPS address with you.
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin, great restaurant too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Jet Park Hotel for one night after arriving from London via Kuala Lumpur and Melbourne., and was absolutley knackered. I arrived at about 12:00pm which was before the specified check-in time, however there was absolutley no problem getting a room early and I was welcomed with a smile. Parking was no problem and was included in the room rate.
reviews.title: Super stop-over hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room looked maybe a little more dated than what the hotel pictures show, however it was more than acceptable and very clean. The room was well stocked with everything that I needed. I slept very well and the bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Staright forward review....
reviews.title: Perfectly Functional

reviews.text: This hotel is ideal if you have an early morning flight from Auckland airport and are arriving late. Although situated on an industrial estate it is only a 5 minute (free) shuttle bus ride away from the airport and the facilities are of a more than adequate standard in regards of cleanliness, size and function. Plus the bar & restaurant are all you need in this sort of scenario.
reviews.title: We were surprised by how good this hotel was.

reviews.text: Recommended for busines travel.
reviews.title: Perfect airport stopover

reviews.text: We were unlucky enough to get caught by the Volcanic Ash Cloud in the middle of our travel between Cairns and Queenstown. Jetstar put us up here for 2 nights with 3 meals a day while we waited for the planes to be able to fly.
reviews.title: Great stopover spot

reviews.text: We were picked up by a very friendly and prompt airport shuttle and delivered safely to the door of the hotel. The reservations staff were wonderful and immediately fixed up in a comfortable studio room that slept 4.
reviews.title: Very handy, very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Jet Park for one night, after flying in from London before our connection to Fiji the following day.
reviews.title: No nonsense place to rest your head

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As our flight arrived in Auckland at 9am, it was important to be able to have an early check in. I emailed the hotel prior to our departure and whilst they said they couldn't guarantee this, on arrival we checked in at 10am with no hassles and were able to have a much needed rest in our comfy room after a 25 hour flight.
reviews.title: perfect airport hotel
Just ok
reviews.text: The room was very spacious, king size bed with comfy pillows. The bathroom had a nice pottery style sink with all the usual guest amenities.
We had drinks at the bar in the evening which were not too expensive and room service for breakfast which was very good with very large portions too!
reviews.title: Will not bother looking for other places to stay. Jet Park will be #1 choice!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we'd hired a car, we didn't make use of the shuttle bus. It was free to park our car.
reviews.title: Just what was expected from an Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Jet Inn many times and each time we have enjoyed the hopitality.The rooms are more than adequate, the toileteries are top of the range, free wifi in the rooms flat screen TVs ,an award winning restaurant,we always book a few weeks in advance and request a ground floor room saves the hassel of the lifts etc. If you are travelling with children it is best to book an early dinner as the restaurant can get very busy the wait can be tedious for children. Good childrens menu.We appreciate the courtesy of the staff. The shuttle service to and from the airport is the gem which brings us back again and again.
reviews.title: We can't fault this property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel appealed because of the free long-stay car-parking. We booked the Romance Package and had a bottle of bubbles and a boxes of roses chocolates. The service was fantastic, the buffet breakfast was delicious and the airport shuttle was prompt. We were so pleased with our stay that we booked another night when we returned to Auckland from our holiday. We didnt eat in the restaurant but had a couple of drinks and the burgers in the bar. They were a little more expensive than your average bar but the service was flawless and the meals were served promptly. We would visit again as a couple. I'm not sure it would be affordable for us as a family (2 adults, 1 child).
reviews.title: Went back for a second night!

reviews.text: the rooms are tiny and our overlooked the southern motorway so was quite noisy as well , the walls must be thin cause we could hear people coming and going all night long , for what you get it is expensive and so is the bar downstairs , although there fish and chips was quite good , reception staff where a bit snobby and rude . i wouldnt recomend it
reviews.title: NEITHER HERE NOR THERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed the night here to get our honeymoon started. The free airport shuttle was great and the service was excellent. We were impressed with the rooms and the cleanliness. The front desk was more than happy to help us with anything and it made our stay very easy. Even the 3.30am shuttle to the airport wasn't an issue. Great service and nice place, glad to be staying on the way back.
reviews.title: Good stop over.

reviews.text: Value for money here. You get a reasonable room for a good price. Nice and clean but the decor is starting to get a little out dated. The restaurant and bar serve great food and service was excellent. If you need to stay near the airport this on a budget then this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: This hotel is in decent state. the rooms are well appointed, and kept clean. Bathrooms are good size. The hotel has one restaurant/bar that has a nice ambiance. But that's about it! The building is a bit old, the area is shabby and definitely wouldn't venture out of the hotel at night. If you need a hotel next to the airport, this is the one for you. If you are looking to cut down the costs while visiting Auckland, I do not advise you to stay here as the distance to downtown is quite substantial. It took 30min and 70 NZD to get there by cab!
reviews.title: Great Hotel bad location

reviews.text: Good clean rooms / friendly service / great price. This hotel is hard to beat if you are traveling overseas and need to stop over for the night. Pick up and drop of at the airport / car storage for the time away/ organizing city transport and all with a smile. Made the trip really stress free. Would not recommend this hotel for a long holiday but for what it was designed for it does well.
reviews.title: Best airport service from a hotel

reviews.text: A slickly run, busy hotel with clean, comfortable rooms and a shuttle to the airport.
reviews.title: Well run airport hotel

reviews.text: It's not where you want to spend a holiday, the hotel is there for overnight stops on arrival or departure, with some short conference facilities. It is in an unattractive setting with a truck depot on one side and housing on the other with a large secure carpark. The hotel itself is pleasant if a little tired.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: I have eaten dinner in the restaurant several times. The food is very good -better than it needs to be given the setting and service level.
reviews.title: Great service let down by poor building

reviews.text: Stayed twice in April: a night after landing in NZ, and the night before leaving NZ. Chose this for its tag as an aiport hotel, though I can't quite understand how/why it would score on the 'conference centre' tag. As an airport hotel, it delivered on all my key expectations from one:
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Easy to access: Though not on the airport, the 24 hr shuttle can be called from the free phone at the i-site before exiting the aiport and it will be there in max 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - No Sleep

reviews.text: 2. Comfortable beds
reviews.title: does the trick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Room service till 3 am
reviews.title: We liked it so much we went back TWICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. Hot breakfast, even if limited in options
reviews.title: One of the BEST airport hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plusses: Everything you get is fast – checkin, checkout, room service. Seeing only one person on the desk, I thought "Uh oh," until I saw how fast she moved.
reviews.title: Bare Bones, and Sometimes Not Even

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Minuses – Not everything is available. Like getting off a long flight at dinner time and being told no table is available for 45 minutes. (Tip: Get room service; it took 10 minutes and uses the same menu.) Like finding out the 5:30 am shuttle to the airport is full so you have to wait until 6 and won’t have time for breakfast at the terminal. (We paid $20 for the hotel's lame continental breakfast. Tip: Make a shuttle reservation and don't count on being able to change at the last minute.)
reviews.title: Very nice hotel for being on airport site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you’re a couple and one is a light sleeper, beware. The bed will shake at 5.5 on the Richter scale every time someone turns over.
reviews.title: Great for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Bottom line: Get in fast – get out fast – and you’ll be happy to leave.
reviews.title: Suited our needs perfectly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (P.S.: Not just for me, but if you find a review useful, please give a click. Some of us spend a lot of time doing these.)
reviews.title: Never again!

aka: Jet Park Airport Hotel And Conference Centre
description: A short walk leads to a warm welcome on our FREE EXCLUSIVE AIRPORT SHUTTLE. 7 minutes to the hotel; FREE PARKING. Travelling on business or pleasure you deserve the best, and that is why we pick you up and drop you off at the airport in style 24/7 FREE of charge. You can leave your car with us while you are away FREE for 14 days, you can relax and refresh in luxury to prepare or recover from your journey and to refuel you will dine on the best cuisine.
